column4: 10.10 is the latest and 11.04 will be latest on the 28th of April

Nope, everything I have is up to date and no issues
jon__, intrader: Do you perhaps have proposed-updates enabled? or backports?
dtchrshr: You need to access your bootloader, i.e. grub
i got no dual boot, if I turn on the pc it goes straight into ubuntu
if you get debian stable, the differences are quite interesting
could you link me or point me in the right direction?
You could back up your data elsewhere and redo all the partitions (and reinstall the systems). Y
or you could take images of your systems, store them elsewhere then redo the partitions and replace the images.
